1.0 Executive Summary

1.1. The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Rinchem Company Inc., Hollister, CA Facility. 



Rinchem Company, Inc. (Rinchem) is committed to being a responsible member of the community in which it operates by giving top priority to operating in a safe and environmentally sound manner. Policy dictates that

Rinchem personnel continuously identify methods to reduce the risk of handling hazardous materials and to reduce the risk to the community and environment through the implementation of new technology and procedures. This commitment to safe and environmentally sound operations is documented in the Team Member Handbook, and the mission statement, which are available to all employees. The Safety and Health policy states:

"SAFETY FIRST is more than a slogan at Rinchem...it is a way of life." Rinchem Company, Inc. is committed to provide a safe working environment for its staff members, its customers and the public, and maintains that

"NO JOB IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF OUR STAFF MEMBERS, OUR COMMUNITIES, AND THE ENVIRONMENT." We recognize that the responsibilities for safety and health are shared among:

Management, in particular the Director of Quality, ES&H, accepts the responsibility for leadership of the safety and health program, for its effectiveness and improvement, and for providing the safeguards required to ensure safe conditions. 



Managers and supervisors are responsible for ensuring processes are documented to reinforce safety as well as the use of engineering controls as the preferred method of promoting safety and eliminating unsafe conditions. 



Staff members are responsible for cooperation with all aspects of the safety and health program including compliance with all rules, documented procedures, and regulations and for continuously practicing safety while performing their duties. They are also responsible for stopping activities that may lead to injuries to themselve

s or others. Staff members, being the most familiar with actual operations, are responsible to document suggestions for continuous improvements. Each employee is granted the authority to stop work if it is deemed unsafe. The job will not be continued until the work methods are evaluated and changed, if necessary, to make the work area safe.



Management continues to do all it can to protect the Health and Safety of all staff and to provide a safe working environment. However, safety requires the participation of everyone...only you can make safety a reality. Be alert for conditions which appear unsafe and report unsafe conditions immediately. Employees are encouraged to report any accident, "near miss", exposure, incident, spill or release.



1.2. A Description of the Hollister, CA Facility and Regulated Substances Handled

1.2.1. Description of the Hollister, CA Facility



The Hollister, CA facility is located at 2301 Bert Drive, Hollister, CA, 95023. The facility provides transportation and public warehousing services for manufacturers, distributors and end users of prepackaged specialty chemicals. Warehousing activities include shipping, receiving and storage of chemicals as specified by customer requirements. The chemicals stored at the Hollister, CA Warehouse include chemicals containing toxic hazards. Hydrogen Chloride is the only RMP regulated substances handled at the site.



1.2.2. Description of the Warehousing and Storage Processes



Rinchem receives Hydrogen Chloride by truck as shipped from the manufacturer or distributor. The material is unloaded from the truck using a forklift and staged for inspection. After the material passes quality and safety inspection, it is placed into the hazard specific storage area until it is shipped to the end user. The storage location of each material is tracked in an electronic inventory management system. After an order is received, Rinchem ships the above listed chemical as ordered by the end user. The material

is picked and staged for quality and safety inspection. After the material passes inspection, it isloaded on to a truck for shipment using a forklift.



1.3. Worst-Case Release Scenario

Well-documented offsite consequence analyses are essential to adequate communication of potential hazards at the Rinchem Hollister, CA Warehouse. Rinchem conducted an offsite consequence analysis, using the EPA's Areal Location of Hazardous Atmospheres (ALOHA) and Marplot in conjunction with the rules specified in 40 CFR 68.25 to estimate the offsite consequence of a Worst-Case Scenario (WCS) from our warehousing process. The WCS associated with toxic substances in the Hollister, CA warehouse is a catastrophic failure of the single largest container resulting in a release of the total contents, 600 Lbs. of Hydrogen Chloride. The passive mitigation measure taken into account for this scenario is the limited quantity of the chemical that can be released due to container and the handling of containers within the building.



1.4. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



Rinchem management realizes that implementation of appropriate administrative and technological safeguards ensure the safety of the workers and the continued safety of public receptors. Those recommendations that are planned for implementation will be discussed in "Planned Changes to Improve Safety". The safeguards shown in Table A-1 include both administrative and technological safeguards that prevent, detect, or mitigate releases of Hydrogen Chloride.



1.5. The Five Year Accident History there has never been a reportable accident involving Hydrogen Chloride at the Hollister, CA Warehouse.



1.6. The Emergency Response Program



Overall safety at the Rinchem Company, Inc, Hollister, CA Warehouse is governed not only by our ability to prevent accidental releases of Hydrogen Chloride from occurring, but also by the ability to mitigate any accidental releases of the

above mentioned material. Rinchem has developed an emergency response program to minimize the effects of accidental releases of Hydrogen Chloride to employees. Rinchem management has opted to respond to releases of these chemical(s) by containing the spill when it can be safely done and using contracted services for spill cleanup.



The Hollister, CA Warehouse Emergency Response Program consists of:

-    Emergency Action Plan and Hazardous Waste Contingency Plan

-    Chemical Exposure and Chemical Spill Cleanup Procedure

-    Emergency Evacuation Plan



The Emergency Response Program outlines the instructions and required information in order to respond to fire, chemical spills, natural disasters and other emergencies that may arise. The emergency response plan and documents are reviewed at least annually and revised as necessary to reflect changes that may occur to content and structure of the plan.
